reviewText: First impression after 16 levels: annoying physics puzzler/3D platformer.\n\nPlease note that most positive reviews have rather short play times; only 3% of players even got the first achievement or finished the game, and judging by the Global Leaderboard" here on Steam
date: those are 12 (twelve) players in all. Why is that? Isn't the game aimed at children familiar with "Bob the Builder"?\nWell
hoursPlayed: but in practice the game suffers from its unpredictable physics; if you had hoped for a sandbox-y experience
voteText: there's little opportunity of that
helpfulPercent: and the game does punish exploration by making you drop through the floor or otherwise fail in many "wtf" ways.\n\nSop you follow the obvious path through a level (which is most often the only path the camera angles actually allow you to see)
votesTotal: with obstinate controls (rotating crane control is especially weird: instead of rotating the crane and moving the trolley
votesFunny: you move the position of the hook up/down/left/right
commentsCount: which can result in some erratic movements). Stacking crates one atop the other with the forklift is practically impossible; it works when the base is wide
column16: i.e. one crate rests on two others. Sort of. Stuff just goes wrong or behaves unexpectedly a lot.\n\nThe physics interactions in this game are quite few; if the devs had not gone with a general physics engine
column17: but written code for these interactions separfately "oldschool" style
column18: the game would have been a lot better. Crates and vehicles don't need to topple over. The crane hook doesn't need to swing around at the end of "fake" cable. The physics code should've allowed the player to execute a solution plan in a predictable fashion. Currently
column19:
that's just not the case.

So who is the target audience for this game? It can't be small children because of the wonky contrrols (no gamepad support) ; it can't be puzzle players because the puzzles are easy; it can't be physics game fans because experimenting with the physics in this game is rarely rewarding.

Get this if you like games that are sort of weird and sort of bad and sort of cheap. You won't miss anything if you don't."
column23: 62 of 70 people (89%) found this review helpful 4 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Love the theme and I like the slow-and-steady approach to the physics-based puzzles...except the puzzle-solving gameplay is perhaps too basic to be at all memorable or incredible and then you also need to get to the puzzles, which is more slow-paced than the puzzles themselves. You'll only admire it for the first half-hour, but thats it.

Also, I am now aware that the developer has released the final build on Steam. This preview is now a review and my reccomendation stays at No"!

reviewText: This game is not for everyone. But I personally love it. Why? Because it's interactive, original, fun, and I can also play it with my 4 year old son. The different machines that you control (cranes, forklifts, cargo trucks, etc.) add interactive layers and scale - for example, you can use a crane to transport a vehicle that can deliver cargo.\n\nThe game can be very tedious and annoying at times, but I never cared about this as a player. I like the core concept, the puzzles, the system, and that's enough to keep me going. I'm not writing this to recommend it to everyone, or to my Steam friends. I'm writing this for the person who is attracted by what they see on the screenshots. If you like the trailer, the screenshots, and don't expect AAA polish from a game made by just one man... and, most importantly, if you're patient and are not easily frustrated, definitely buy it.

reviewText: Picture this example: you're working on a puzzle for, say, 20-30 minutes now. The solution" requires stacking containers and crates
date: and you're struggling against the (rather bad) physics engine but overall making progress. And then due to some random not-your-fault physics bug
recommended: a key element of the puzzle just flies off of the building and is not recoverable. You must suicide your Mr. B and start over
hoursPlayed: effectively forfeiting these 20+ minutes of work. How would you react?\n\nBecause if this would make you angry (and honestly it should) then stay well away from this game. This kind of thing happened to me
voteText: and more than once. But the strange thing is
helpfulPercent: I found the game amusing enough that I managed to plough through all of this and actually enjoy it. But that's just me: I enjoy quirky (bad) games.\n\nAnd there is a lot of "quirkiness" here indeed. The graphics are plain terrible
votesHelpful: even by my (lax) standards. The crazy physics simulation is your worst enemy. The music
votesFunny: is some sort of open source thing because I am 99% confident I heard it in another Unity game recently. Controls seem kinda floaty yet are suprisingly precise if you have the patience for them. The level design is... pretty good sometimes; it has its moments. I'd recommend getting this only at a significant discount. There is some weird amusement to be had here but extracting it is not for the faint of heart."

reviewText:
- This review isn't written by a native speaker, thank you for your understanding -

Rating between Good and Must Play

- Key features below ---- Review after -----------------------------------------------
Play time needed (perfect) 6 hours and more
Gaming level Casual
Achievement level Casual
Game style Puzzle-platformer, Simulation (cars, fork lift, crane...)
Game modes Story mode (solo)
Story A guy who wanted to go to work.
Voice No.
Music Yes, some.
Camera A little nasty sometimes. Additional camera in some part of the game.
Controls Mouse or Keyboard. (Controller?)
Tutorial Yes.
Unmissable / backtracking content Yes.
Glitches / bugs Unfortunately, refer to (*) below.
Worth price Yes, it worth it.

- Review below ----------------------------------------------------------------------
The Adventures of Mr. Bobley is great as it mostly an adventure through many building sites using the environment to get from one site to another. You use many engine such as cars, fork lift, crane and many others. You can interact with many part of the environment. So it's mostly a puzzle platforming game with some simulation features. Bobley have a special ability, he can't be hurt if he jump and make himself as a boulder before landing. One of the great feature of this game are some additional camera in some part of the game that let you see what's going on around you. Also there is some pretty fun levels such as a maze, a football match played alone, a frogger like game (the game where you help a frog to crosse the traffic jam) and many others.

I would rate this game as Must Play but there is some bad things that can sometimes happen to you (*) :

Your car or any engin with wheels can be stuck in the wall and it can be over as you can't take the engine out of the wall.

The camera is sometimes awful as it may hide the part you want to see and even make you blind sometimes..

Bobley can sometimes shoot in some crates and others by jumping on them.

The are also some jumping glitches that may help you to finish some levels, skipping the puzzle.

And so in this game you also need to be very patient in some part of the game, especially the part when you need to stack stuff and try everything to not let it collapse.

reviewText: I would write a joke positive review of this game, but really that is too ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing good for this game. I see this game has a 62% positive rating on Steam and that is attrocious. This game is by far one of the worst things on Steam I would still qualify as a game. This game is based around physics and the physics in the game are awful and VERY slow. Everything moves VERY slow. Whether it's falling or it's a crane moving an object or the godforesaken elevators, it's just a nightmare of wasted time to try to accomplish any task. Also the difficulty is completely random amoung levels. Level 9 took literally an hour and a half, Level 10 took like 10 minutes, or at least it felt like that in comparison; like I said everything is very slow. Also the machines and vehciles, despite being slow, often get stuck in the ground or anything else really, rendering them useless. That is all I have to say, never buy this game.

reviewText:
> Be me
> Be Bobley
> Laid off from work for allegedly wrecking multiple construction vehicles
> Find it easier to roll around in a ball than walk at times
> People claim this may be a drinking problem
> But red round nose is genetic. Father Bobley also red nosed
> Wake up one morning and drink very much Vlad
> FeelingGood.mpg.jpeg
> Decide to show up to my old job's site and finish it on my own
> Will show dedication and value
> Drive to job site
> Roll around up some ramps and elevators
> Steal a car
> Drive car off ledge and land on adjacent job site
> F*ck that car
> Elevator to the top
> Steal another car
> Drive car off ledge
> F*ck that car too
> Find forklift on like the 288th floor
> Steal forklift to get heavy box out of my way
> Certified forklift operator so no big deal
> Lift up box
> Box falls off ledge
> Box falls for 7 solid minutes
> Box kills dozens upon impact
> Forklift loses grip and falls off ledge
> I tuck and roll off forklift mid-flight down
> I commence the ball roll position
> Still falling
> Impact
> Dozens more killed
> Still in ball roll position
> Bobley fine
> MFW I get supervisor promotion next day

reviewText:
Probably the most challenging and most rewarding video game I have ever played. A true simulation of real life.

You start out as Bobley, you wake up in the middle of no where, and have no ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing idea where you are. This doesn't matter to Bobley, there is construction to be done. You get up and hop across buildings and cranes. You drive trucks and forklifts to their doom. You drive a nitrous fuled dump truck and shoot your load everywhere. The whole time you have no idea what the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• is going on but you slowly grow to realise that this is always going to get harder, and will never end. This is what hell looks like.

Theres work to be done Bobley, Get to it.

reviewText:
The Surgeon Simulator among puzzle gamesYou mostly waddle around slowly, ride slow elevators or drive slow vehicles. In between you solve physics puzzles which will probably not challenge anybody above age 4, except when trying to execute the solution. The physics and camera are the real challenge in this game and will test your frustration tolerance.

Pros:- nice music and it's available for free from http://incompetech.com I really like four of the five tracks used in the game:
Call to Adventure, Radio Martini, Run Amok, The Builder
- some parts of the physics work really well. I only managed to glitch through one closed door that was supposed to be an impassable level border during the whole playthrough. Jumping onto crates is assisted, making it really easy
- good variety of challenges, most of which sadly suffer from playing like Surgeon Simulator
- nice setting, family friendly. All you do is make your way through a huge construction site. With smoother edges and more variety it would even look good
- some of the puzzles are fun, even if they are easy. I especially liked the balls through pipes puzzle (level 22 or thereabouts)

Cons:- bad camera: it's incredibly difficult to exactly place a pallet on top of something, jumps are hard to judge (the jump target marker is frequently wrong and absent for the deliberately difficult jumps)
- bad physics: Imagine trying to solve a series of puzzles with Surgeon Simulator controls. Add to that a bunch of glitches: balls that are supposeed to roll somewhere get stuck, stuff sinks into the floor a lot making it impossible to pick up with a forklift, good luck trying to pick up a flipped over pallet or putting it right side up again, vehicle tires can get stuck in miniscule gaps, vehicles tend to get completely stuck on top of empty pallets, and so on
- the puzzles are a joke. The two times I was stuck for a while were both cases of not finding/recognizing a piece of the puzzle right away
- walking simulator: you spend 90% of your time crawling around the level, and most other actions are equally slow
- Mr. Bobley is the ugly, geriatric brother of Bob the Builder, complete with red nose and a waddle that suggests serious pelvis displacement. The man needs a doctor

reviewText:
You wanna experience what Bob The Builder probably experienced his first day on the job then this is the game for you. I'm serious this games is being a construction worker without any construction, essentially, a walking simulator where you're taking tours of construction sites. You also must be in the matrix or some ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• because there are no people or even streets in this city.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=607317438

And to top it all off, this is what happened when I tried to go through a door.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=607317898

Granted I only played about 15 minutes of this game but if you can get through more of this game while having to listen to one really generic song over and over again and stare at a largly grey landscape, I salute you.

reviewText: I love idea of this game - platformer on construction site? Seems fun. Being able to drive and use heavy machines? GREAT! Sadly, this idea wasn't made into something cool. Somewhere in half of levels I got bored with it. Finishing up to 2 or 3 levels was maximum what I could do. Some levels are really hard to beat - not because of difficult of puzzles or level design, no. Some of levels are hard to beat because doing it in normal way seems impossible. I can't count how many times my fork truck got stuck somewhere, box flied out of map, I couldn't jump from one place to another or hitted something invisible while driving. There was always more easy way to do almost everything and it's called bugs. Finding one to beat level was more fun and more easier instead of getting tired because rolling over some machine wasn't possible or it landed in some strange place, leaving level reset as only working option. Also, the last level made me laught, because I thought Mr. Bobley will commit suicide because of all those strange things he needed to do. I had some fun but not enough to recommend this game. Maybe if you don't mind bugs and enjoy strange 3D platformers, you could get it. Otherwise stay away from it.

reviewText:
There are more drawbacks in this game than benefits. Only did it for the achievements and for another 100% game.

Pros:
- You drive some vehicles like dump trucks, cars, heavy machinery, etc.
- The music isn't bad. I liked it.

Cons:
- The game has so many glitches it's barely playable. Spent 1 hour on a level that can be done in less than 5 minutes. You may die or may have to restart a level because the game glitches so often and so much.
- Really not worth 4 euros. Should be 1 euro max. And I wouldn't even pay that much.
- Although the achievements are easy it may take a while to get them all. Took me ~8 hours...
- It's unrealistic. Your car flips so you click with your mouse and after a while, eventually, it's how it was before it fliped. You can jump from literally 100 metres and before you fall if you roll you won't die.
- If you drive a vehicle fast or not even that fast and you try to perfom a simple turn your vehicle may flip. So easy to flip a vehicle..
- I died on a level and I respawned not where I should have been but where I would have been if I have made it. Wtf?
- You can hold right or left mouse button (not sure which one it was) before you jump and it will show you where you would land so you can make a more precise jump. This seems like a postive thing, right? Well, the thing is it's not always showing you where you would land so yeah...

Conclusion:
Avoid at all costs. I bought it 85 off (~0,60 euros) and that's an ok-ish price but I don't recommend spending more than that. It should be free even.. But it can't because there are trading cards. So buy this if you're going to idle for cards or if you want to get all achievements, otherwise don't bother buying this. If there weren't so many glitches this would have been a great game and I would have given it a positive review. I don't like giving negative reviews but sometimes I just have to...

reviewText: I gave this game a half-hour of my life, and it didn't even to manage to get started.  I took the slow, plodding character through levels that introduced concept after concept, but never asked me to do anything challenging with any of them.  After a half-hour of play, Mr. Bobley still felt like a tutorial.  The controls are awkwardly implemented, calling for keys too far apart to be hit with one hand, but also the mouse.  Some design decisions, like having players take elevators up or down floor-by-floor, when only two floors are actually revelant to the level, seem amateurish.\n\nUnity is somewhat overly maligned as a game engine.  There really have been some good games made in Unity.  Mr. Bobley, however, is not one of them.  Since, in thirty minutes of play, it could not manage to deliver up a single fun moment, I have lost hope that it ever would become enjoyable.  I let it run long enough to get my Trading Cards, and deleted.

reviewText:
oh sweet baby jesus, i need your help. we have a big problem! the devil has brought this horror to the earth and disguised it as a steam game! it is worse than you think too, because he is trying to force us to use the page up and page down keys on the keyboard to play the game. even an evil mortal sinner dev wouldn't resort to such a terrible punishment!

let us count up all the sins in this game.  clearly the main character exists only because bob the builder mated with a mole. such a sin against nature hasn't existed since you destroyed that nasty island of doctor moreau. i feel so dirty just moving the character around the screen.

blessed jesus, how the game lies to us! it promises puzzles. i admit that i was puzzled by what are clearly the worst jumping mechanics in the last decade of gaming. i was very confused when i went up a set of stairs and the next level looked exactly the same as the one i was just on, but i went ahead and climbed the stairs again. to my horror that level also looked exactly the same as the last two. i know you were by my side, dear jesus, so you can help me explain to the sinners that this did indeed happen for 6 or 7 levels in a row.

we can't forget the devil's dirty tricks either.  i am glad you were there to give me strength when i entered that elevator and the message popped up on the screen to press page up and page down to control it. any other evil sinner dev would not have had that message pop up, and the game would be over for me and all the rest of the sinners because no mortal would ever hit page up to do anything in any game ever. why not scroll lock? why not zoidberg? ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• you devil, i know what you are up to here.

how i hate the devil for giving moleman the power to roll up into a ball, but not giving me the ability to control the moleball! what a dirty deed to trick me into thinking there might be something i can do in this game that resembles fun.

finally, we got to the part where i was supposed to get in a car, and the devil tipped his hand. he wanted me to do a suicide so he could claim my soul! His sinister pop up box said 'go ahead and get into a car', but there was no way to get into any of the cars! i was ready to take my own life, but then i realized the big secret... dev is short for devil! oh foulest of demons, you almost tricked me! Fortunately i am confident that with the help of almighty jesus, we can use this review to keep you from acquiring any of the souls you so desperately desire.

god bless amen
